snippet: Roger Federer fully expects his left knee to hold up when he returns to action at the Monte Carlo Masters on Tuesday, and the 17-time Grand Slam champion feels "mentally and physically" rested after more than two months out....
lead_paragraph: Roger Federer fully expects his left knee to hold up when he returns to action at the Monte Carlo Masters on Tuesday, and the 17-time Grand Slam champion feels "mentally and physically" rested after more than two months out.

headline.print_headline: Federer Confident His Knee Will Hold Up on Return to Action
headline.main: Federer Confident His Knee Will Hold Up on Return to Action
